result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dequon Montrell Garrett appeared by video, in custody at WCJ.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran appeared by video for Dequon Montrell Garrett.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to be physically present at today's hearing and accepts consent to use of video conferencing. Defendant not eligible for State Public Defender. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Colloquy regarding bond.  Court sets $500 sig bond and enters not guilty plea. Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
